title: Alternative to Dione/DSType?
content:
Hi forum!

Can anyone recommend an alternative to Dione/DSType?

[http://www.identifont.com/find?font=dione&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019011116/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=dione&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=dione&q=Go")

Thanks!

/Henriko
author: superfetz

comments.content: Maybe [Apex New](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019011116/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/). Depends on how important the character width is though.

Hi Henriko,  
 [this older thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019011116/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28458) lists a number of sans-serif typefaces with rather squarish – and open – forms.  
F
